content.rendered:
We are seeking an individual experienced in establishment and analysis of animal models to support biologics drug discovery.  The candidate should be familiar with a variety of in vivo handling techniques and skilled in ex vivo cell-based assays. As part of this team you will have the opportunity to play a key role in the discovery and development of novel immuno-oncology biotherapeutics.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Cell line growth and characterization
  • Syngeneic/xenograft tumor inoculation
  • Tumor growth measurements
  • Dosing of therapeutics
  • Collection of bleeds and necropsy
  • Ex vivo immune cell analysis

Qualifications

  • Associates or Bachelor’s degree in Biology or related science field with 4+years of relevant in vivo experience in a biotech or industrial setting
  • Extensive experience with in vivo mouse models, including implantable tumor models
  • Hands-on expertise with orthotopic models preferred
  • Experience with cell line work, flow cytometry and ELISA assays
  • Ability to follow defined procedures and protocols
  • Willingness to learn new research methods
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Great record-keeping, communication and time-management skills
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team setting
  • Demonstrated accountability and responsibility for own work
  • Interest in working in a highly collaborative, fast paced and exciting biotech environment.
